name: Janeway Was...
description: It's the trial of the century, as the denizens of the Alpha Quadrant learn of the choice Janeway had to make regarding Tuvix. What was once a difficult moral conundrum has now become fodder for replomat talk across the galaxy! So, was Janeway right?
rules:
-- There are two Phases to this Event! Each Phase is individually timed.
-- In this Hybrid Event, you will complete Faction Missions in one phase, and Supply Missions in another phase.
-- Unique Federation, and Section 31 Faction Missions are available during the event. Open the Event to access them.
-- Using any version of Maddox, Janeway, Sloan, Vulcan, or Mylean will provide a bonus to Faction Missions and Supply Missions.
-- Every Faction or Supply Mission you complete earns you Event Victory Points. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
-- Community Rewards are also available during Phase 2 only. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock these rewards before the phase change!
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Crew Bonus: Maddox, Janeway, Sloan, Vulcan, or Mylean
rewards_teaser: Reach Rank 1 by gaining Victory Points from Event Missions!

featured_crew.name: Thalia
featured_crew.flavor: Princess Thalia will stay behind guarding her little princess Runa. Should King Ridley fall in battle, she will sing an epic song to honor him.

featured_crew.name: Janeway
featured_crew.flavor: Some decisions are too difficult. And despite looking stern during the separation process, Janeway can barely contain her emotions afterward.

featured_crew.name: Sloan
featured_crew.flavor: An operative in the Section 31 intelligence agency, he frequently sparred with Julian Bashir.

rewards.name: Chronitons
rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

rewards.name: Tuvok
rewards.flavor: Security Chief for Captain Janeway, and former infiltrator of the Maquis ship Val Jean.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.name: Chronitons
rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

rewards.name: Credits
rewards.flavor: Credits are the galaxy's standard currency. Use Credits in the Time Portal to enlist crew members, build items, and more.

rewards.name: Honor
rewards.flavor: Honor is gained by dismissing crew who have served you well, but are ready for reassignment. Redeem in the Time Portal for exclusive crew, special fusion-related items, training programs, and more.

rewards.name: Voyage Revival
rewards.flavor: Use to instantly revive a failed Voyage.

rewards.flavor: An operative in the Section 31 intelligence agency, he frequently sparred with Julian Bashir.

rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 5 Polestars: Common, Uncommon, Rare, Super rare, Legendary

rewards.name: Skill
rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 6 Polestars: Command, Diplomacy, Security, Engineering, Science, Medicine

rewards.name: ISM
rewards.flavor: ISM, or interstellar medium, is the matter that exists between astronomical objects. It can be manipulated by the Q to facilitate crew retrieval. ISM can be obtained from Daily Log-in Rewards, Campaigns and participating in Fleet activities.

rewards.flavor: Honor is gained by dismissing crew who have served you well, but are ready for reassignment. Redeem in the Time Portal for exclusive crew, special fusion-related items, training programs, and more.

rewards.name: Merits
rewards.flavor: Merits can be earned by completing missions. Use Merits to acquire faction-based rewards, upgrades to your ship, and more.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.name: Thalia
rewards.flavor: Princess Thalia will stay behind guarding her little princess Runa. Should King Ridley fall in battle, she will sing an epic song to honor him.

rewards.name: Sloan
rewards.flavor: An operative in the Section 31 intelligence agency, he frequently sparred with Julian Bashir.

rewards.name: Rarity
rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 5 Polestars: Common, Uncommon, Rare, Super rare, Legendary

rewards.name: ISM
rewards.flavor: ISM, or interstellar medium, is the matter that exists between astronomical objects. It can be manipulated by the Q to facilitate crew retrieval. ISM can be obtained from Daily Log-in Rewards, Campaigns and participating in Fleet activities.

rewards.name: Sloan
rewards.flavor: An operative in the Section 31 intelligence agency, he frequently sparred with Julian Bashir.

rewards.name: Janeway
rewards.flavor: Some decisions are too difficult. And despite looking stern during the separation process, Janeway can barely contain her emotions afterward.

rewards.name: 10x Portal
rewards.flavor: 10 valuable items. Go to Time Portal to collect!

screens.text: "Captain Janeway, of the Starfleet vessel USS Voyager, you are here today to stand trial for your actions on stardate 49678.4. Specifically, your decision to separate the entity Tuvix into the original entities Tuvok, Neelix, and the orchid that bound them. Do you understand?"

"With deepest respect to the court and to you, Commander, no. I do not. Make no mistake. The decision regarding Tuvix was not an easy one. But as captain, I did what I had to as captain. I do not see why we are revisiting this now."

"Maybe for you, this matter is in the past, Captain Janeway. But I cannot accept that this could be how my story is supposed to end. What about my life, my existence? Perhaps the temporal anomaly crisis has brought me here for a reason. To hold you to account."

"Any decision reached in this matter could have far-reaching implications. Federation stances on everything from genetic engineering to Borg technology and parasites could require reevaluation. Captain, we could use your help investigating. Where do you fall on this matter?"

"Captain Janeway, of the Starfleet vessel USS Voyager, you are here today to stand trial for your actions on stardate 49678.4. Specifically, your decision to separate the entity Tuvix into the original entities Tuvok, Neelix, and the orchid that bound them. Do you understand?"

"With deepest respect to the court and to you, Commander, no. I do not. Make no mistake. The decision regarding Tuvix was not an easy one. But as captain, I did what I had to as captain. I do not see why we are revisiting this now."

"Maybe for you, this matter is in the past, Captain Janeway. But I cannot accept that this could be how my story is supposed to end. What about my life, my existence? Perhaps the temporal anomaly crisis has brought me here for a reason. To hold you to account."

"Any decision reached in this matter could have far-reaching implications. Federation stances on everything from genetic engineering to Borg technology and parasites could require reevaluation. Captain, we could use your help investigating. Where do you fall on this matter?"
